alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 3:18AM EDT until June 14 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Crawford and Marion. In northwest Ohio, Hancock, Seneca, Wood and Wyandot. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Findlay, Marion, Fostoria, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, North Baltimore, McComb, Arlington, Sycamore, La Rue, Arcadia, Rawson, Morral, Vanlue, Van Buren, New Riegel, Chatfield, Marseilles, Carey and Benton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
